verses.verse: Behold<WH3303>, you are fair, my love<WH7474>; behold<WH3303>, you are fair; you have doves<WH3123>' eyes<WH5869> inside<WH1157> your locks<WH6777>: your hair<WH8181> is as a flock<WH5739> of goats<WH5795>, that appear<WH1570> from mountain<WH2022> Gilead<WH1568>.

Your teeth<WH8127> are like a flock<WH5739> of sheep that are even shorn<WH7094>, which came up<WH5927> from the washing<WH7367>; whereof every one carry twins<WH8382>, and none is childless among them<WH7909>.

Your lips<WH8193> are like a thread<WH2339> of scarlet<WH8144>, and your speech<WH4057> is fitting<WH5000>: your temples<WH7541> are like a piece<WH6400> of a pomegranate<WH7416> inside<WH1157> your locks<WH6777>.

Your neck<WH6677> is like the tower<WH4026> of David<WH1732> built<WH1129> for a armoury<WH8530>, whereon there hang<WH8518> a thousand<WH505> bucklers<WH4043>, all shields<WH7982> of mighty men<WH1368>.
Your two<WH8147> breasts<WH7699> are like two<WH8147> young<WH6082> roes<WH6646> that are twins<WH8380>, which feed<WH7462> among the lilies<WH7799>.
Until the day<WH3117> break<WH6315>, and the shadows<WH6752> flee away<WH5127>, I will get<WH3212> me to the mountain<WH2022> of myrrh<WH4753>, and to the hill<WH1389> of frankincense<WH3828>.
You are all fair<WH3303>, my love<WH7474>; there is no spot in you<WH3971>.

Come<WH935> with me from Lebanon<WH3844>, my spouse<WH3618>, with me from Lebanon<WH3844>: look<WH7789> from the top<WH7218> of Amana<WH549>, from the top<WH7218> of Shenir<WH8149> and Hermon<WH2768>, from the lions<WH738>' dens<WH4585>, from the mountains<WH2042> of the leopards<WH5246>.
You have ravished my heart<WH3823>, my sister<WH269>, my spouse<WH3618>; you have ravished my heart<WH3823> with one<WH259> of your eyes<WH5869>, with one<WH259> chain<WH6060> of your neck<WH6677>.

How fair<WH3302> is your love<WH1730>, my sister<WH269>, my spouse<WH3618>! how much better<WH2895> is your love<WH1730> than wine<WH3196>! and the smell<WH7381> of your ointments<WH8081> than all spices<WH1314>!

Your lips<WH8193>, O my spouse<WH3618>, drop<WH5197> as the honeycomb<WH5317>: honey<WH1706> and milk<WH2461> are under your tongue<WH3956>; and the smell<WH7381> of your garments<WH8008> is like the smell<WH7381> of Lebanon<WH3844>.
A garden<WH1588> enclosed<WH5274> is my sister<WH269>, my spouse<WH3618>; a spring<WH1530> shut up<WH5274>, a fountain<WH4599> sealed<WH2856>.
Your plants<WH7973> are a orchard<WH6508> of pomegranates<WH7416>, with pleasant<WH4022> fruits<WH6529>; camphire<WH3724>, with spikenard<WH5373>,
Spikenard<WH5373> and saffron<WH3750>; cane<WH7070> and cinnamon<WH7076>, with all trees<WH6086> of frankincense<WH3828>; myrrh<WH4753> and aloes<WH174>, with all the chief<WH7218> spices<WH1314>:
A fountain<WH4599> of gardens<WH1588>, a well<WH875> of living<WH2416> waters<WH4325>, and streams<WH5140> from Lebanon<WH3844>.

Awake<WH5782>, O north wind<WH6828>; and come<WH935>, you south<WH8486>; blow<WH6315> upon my garden<WH1588>, that the spices<WH1314> there may flow out<WH5140>. Let my beloved<WH1730> come<WH935> into his garden<WH1588>, and eat<WH398> his pleasant<WH4022> fruits<WH6529>.
